trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of Triple Antibiotic Therapy in Symptomatic Blastocystis patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In patients with symptomatic Blastocystis, is triple antibiotic therapy effective in clearing Blastocystis from the stool and improving clinical well-being?

interventions.interventions: Administration of 14 days of oral capsule antibiotics: specifically trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole 160/800mg twice daily, diloxanide furoate 500 mg three times daily and secnidazole 400mg three times daily
interventions.comparator: Before and after; No control group

primaryOutcome.outcome: Clearance of Blastocystis from stool specimen
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, 15 day and 6 weeks after 14 days of antibiotic therapy

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in clinical well being; patient diary
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline, day 15 and week 6 after antibiotic therapy

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Gastrointestinal symptoms No other cause except Blastocystis found on investigation Good general health
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Allergy to Sulphurs Pregnancy or risk of pregnancy

trial_design.concealment: Exclusion of other causes of gastrointestinal symptoms with clinical history, examination, routine blood tests and stool cultures and an upper and lower endoscopy.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: School of Veterinary Science University of Queensland Gatton Campus Warrego Hwy Gatton, QLD 4352

fundingsource.fundingname: School of Veterinary Science, University of Queensland
fundingsource.fundingaddress: Building 8114, Gatton Campus Warrego Hwy, Gatton QLD, 4352

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Suite 105, Medici Medical Centre 11 Scott St Toowoomba, QLD 4350

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We intend to evaluate the efficacy of 14 days of the triple antibiotics listed above in eradicating Blastocystis infection in symptomatic patients.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Medical research Ethics Committee University of Queensland
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: University of Queensland Cumbrae-Stewart Building Research Rd Brisbane, Qld 4072
